title: Renuka Devi Temple
subtitle: Sacred Abode of Goddess Renuka Devi, Mahur
overview: The Renuka Devi Temple in Mahur is one of the most important Shakti Peethas in Maharashtra, dedicated to Goddess Renuka Devi, the mother of Lord Parashurama. Perched atop a hill amidst dense forests, this ancient temple holds deep mythological and spiritual significance.
Pilgrims from across the country visit Mahur to seek blessings from the Goddess, especially during Navratri when the temple is adorned beautifully, and special rituals are performed.

highlights.title: Sacred Shakti Peetha
highlights.description: One of the three and a half Shakti Peethas of Maharashtra, signifying immense spiritual power.

highlights.title: Hilltop Sanctuary
highlights.description: Located atop a scenic hill offering panoramic views of the surrounding forest and valleys.

geography.intro: Mahur is a picturesque town located in Nanded district, surrounded by dense forests and hills that add to the temple’s serenity.

climate.description: Mahur has a tropical climate with hot summers, pleasant winters, and moderate monsoons.

seasons.text: Best time to visit: October to February

geography.conclusion: The winter months are ideal for visiting Renuka Devi Temple when the climate is cool and comfortable for trekking up the hill.

activities.title: Trek to the Temple
activities.description: Climb up the hill through scenic pathways to reach the divine temple at the top.
info: Approximately 400 steps lead to the main temple
Rest spots and small shops are available along the way

activities.title: Darshan and Aarti
activities.description: Experience the divine atmosphere during morning and evening aartis.

activities.title: Navratri Festival
activities.description: Join thousands of devotees during the Navratri celebrations when the temple is vibrantly decorated.
info: Special poojas and processions throughout Navratri
Cultural programs and devotional music performances

attractions.title: Anasuya Devi Temple
attractions.description: Another important shrine in Mahur dedicated to Anasuya Devi, mother of the Trimurti — Brahma, Vishnu, and Mahesh.
attractions.value: A major stop for pilgrims visiting Mahur

attractions.title: Lord Dattatreya Temple
attractions.description: Situated on a nearby hill, this ancient temple is believed to be the birthplace of Lord Dattatreya.

marineLife.intro: While Mahur is located inland, its spiritual environment flourishes with rich traditions and rituals.

items.title: Nature and Peace
items.description: The temple surroundings are lush and tranquil, fostering meditation and reflection.

items.title: Cultural Heritage
items.description: Mahur has a deep-rooted cultural connection to ancient Hindu scriptures and legends.

conclusion: Mahur is a perfect blend of divinity and nature’s serenity.
The Renuka Devi Temple continues to attract devotees seeking spiritual awakening and peace.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Nearest railway station: Kinwat (55 km) or Nanded (130 km).
Regular trains connect Nanded with major cities like Mumbai, Hyderabad, and Aurangabad.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Frequent buses available from Nanded, Kinwat, and Yavatmal to Mahur.
Private taxis and jeeps are available for local transport.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Flights available from Mumbai, Hyderabad, and Pune.

bookingTips.description: Limited accommodation is available near the temple; book in advance during festivals.
Wear comfortable footwear as the path involves a steep climb.
Carry water and essentials when trekking, especially during summer visits.
